Title.S: 0-2. Getting Started with App Runner using Copilot

Detail.S:
As you're seeing this page, you're successfully running the [sample application](https://github.com/aws-containers/hello-app-runner-nodejs) on App Runner using Copilot!

Back to the [top page](/) for further steps!

You'll execute two Copilot commands to set-up your release pipeline in CodePiepline as follows:

```
$ copilot pipeline init

$ copilot pipeline update
```

Note that you may require to take manual actions to authorize Copilot access to your GitHub repository. If you're using AWS CodeCommit for the tutorial, then it'll required no manual actions and be configured in a fully automated way.

In this step, you'll make some edits in the file in your local workspace, and commit & push it to your Git repository to check how the pipeline you've created in the previous step works.

Here's the summary of the commands:

```bash
$ vim ./components/layout.js

$ git add . && git commit -m "Update something"

$ git push
```

In this final step, all you will do is just executing one command. Then Copilot will take care of everything to wipe out the resources you've created in this tutorial.

```bash
$ copilot app delete --name my-app --yes
```

Well done!
